posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: Our team found this battery charger and we were wondering if it worked on FRC batteries.

posts.name: bgg
posts.cooked:
Looks like a no go.

R604 *Charge batteries at a safe rate. Any battery charger used to charge a ROBOT battery may not be used such that it exceeds 6-Amp average charge current

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
Exactly.  Per R604 , this would not be legal at a competition, and Robot Inspectors are told to look out for fast chargers when they’re checking your batteries.

This rule doesn’t apply at home, of course, but I can’t tell you this would be safe, especially if left unattended overnight, or good for the lifetime of your batteries.

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked:
As others have said, that one isn’t okay. But there seem to be others from the same company with a slower charge rate

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked:
We just recently found this charger in our shop too. IMG_2451 3024×4032 2.98 MB Is this one legal?

IMG_2451 3024×4032 2.98 MB

IMG_2451 3024×4032 2.98 MB

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
It looks like it says 1.1A/BANK in the upper right corner.

If so…yes this is legal (<=6A charge rate/battery)…but it will charge slowly. A dead empty 18AH battery in…18 or more hours to a full charge.

posts.name: Pat Mattin
posts.cooked: Not a bad choice, just want to note that you really want at least 2 or 3 chargers. We’ve got a 3 bank charger, with 4 batteries in rotation it’s not too hard to always have 2 fully charged throughout a competition.
